question: Which Indian airport has become the world’s busiest single-runway airport?
option4: Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose International Airport
explanation: The Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International airport has become the world’s busiest single-runway airport, after creating a new world record for single-runway operations by handling 980 arrivals and take-offs in 24 hours, or almost one flight every minute on January 20, 2018.
